conversations.content: Please note that this story contains spoilers for event ＂The Phantom's Ransom.＂
Cap'n!
This be the last thing we ever ask of ye! We're beggin' ye, Cap'n—just one show!
Well, this certainly seems like a big to-do. What's going on, Karina?
Oh, nothing much. I guess you remember how I took on a substitute role in the opera a while back, yes?
You mean when the lead singer of the Speranza Opera Troupe was kidnapped?
You played a princess torn by a tragic romance—and you were great!
Yar, so we heard! But we sea rats were out on the bilgey blue when our fair cap'n performed, and we wanna be seein' her, so we do.
Ye gotta let us see ya, Cap'n! Ya just gotta! Why, even me parrot's gonna cry salty tears if ya don't give us a show.
Ugh, fine. If it'll stop all this belly-aching, I'll do it. I still have the dress, after all.
ALL HAIL THE CAP'N! HIP HIP, YAR!
Though I fear I'll be something of a one-woman show without the orchestra.
But that's no excuse for not putting on the best performance I can—so get ready to bawl your beady little eyes out, boys!
Word of Karina's upcoming performance spreads in an instant throughout the Halidom.
La la laaaaaa! Ah, that's excellent. Sounds like the pipes are still pipin'. Time to get this show on the...
...road? Okay, what's with all the people?!
They're excited to see you, Karina! It's not every day they get to experience an actual opera, after all.
It's not? Huh.
ARR! CAP'N!
Gar, but ye look a sight! Why, the sun shimmerin' over the horizon could scarce shine brighter'n ye are now!
Ye look a princess fair and true, Cap'n!
*SWOOOOOON*
Shut your traps, you sealubbers! You're supposed to be QUIET when you're in a theater!
...Yar.
Close enough. Now then! If no one has anything else they feel like yelling, let the show begin!
Hold my hand and I will feel no fear. ♪
Amid our restless feelings, the future draws near. ♪
After the performance...
Well? How'd you scurvy dogs like it?
Brilliant, Cap'n! Absolutely brilliant! I'd sell me dear old ma's peg leg to hear just a minute more!
I've never been so moved in all me days! I shed a tear, so I did! A real one, by gar!
I ain't never seen an opera, Cap'n, but ye made this old salt's heart sing.
You haven't... Wait, is this the first time ANY of you have seen an opera?
I be born in the boonies, and there warn't a proper theater around for forty leagues.
I grew up near a big town with a theater, but me family be so poor, we couldn't afford to go.
Yar, and I be so overpowered by the fanciness of the theater that I couldn't even make me legs approach it...
Figured all them rich folk would think commonfolk like me weren't welcome at their fancy hornpipe party...
So THIS is what the prince meant!
(Now that I think back on it, the only people I ever saw at the opera were other nobles and upper-crust types.)
(In other words, only a handful of people are ever able to see the truly wonderful art that is the opera.)
(The idea our world is so unequal that some don't have the freedom to do such things is an injustice I cannot stand!)
That does it! From this day forth, I'm going to set out on my ship and deliver opera to the entire world!
Wh-what?!
Yar, what do ye mean, Cap'n?!
I mean, I'm gonna sail my ship across the ocean blue to shores without professional companies and bring free opera to the masses!
That way EVERYONE can see an opera, no matter where they live or their station in society! Great idea, no?
Yaaaar...? So ya mean the opera ye just did will be spreadin' across the world?
That's the idea—but if we're going to do it right, we'll need a proper set.
Speranza carried their entire theater around inside the belly of a dragon.
So we'll copy that idea and carry our gear around in the belly of my ship!
A stage on a ship?! Yer a blasted genius, Cap'n! Gar, yer TWO geniuses!
Er, hold on. If ye be usin' our ship, that means we be...
Nooo! Ye can't be breakin' up our motley pirate band, Cap'n!
Oh, for heaven's sake. Stop bawling! You're all coming with me.
...Yar?
I've heard all of you sing out at sea— your shanties are the stuff of legend!
And if you've got courage enough to be a pirate, you DEFINITELY have the guts to climb on that stage and belt out a tune.
Er...uh...gar?
Yar, I've no faith at all in me ability to be an opera singer, Cap'n.
Relax, all of you. No one is expecting you to be REAL opera singers.
I'm directing this show, and the last thing I want is some traditional, boring thing.
Our show will be lively and free! ...Oh, and maybe a bit bonkers.
Now THAT sounds like a rip-roarin' time!
Hell yeah! We'll do a pirate-style opera, one those proper, fussy troupes couldn't put on in a million years. Now come on, you dogs! Let's do this!
AYE-AYE, CAP'N!
Hoist the anchor! From this day forth, we are Karina's Pirate Opera Troupe!
Sorry for the trouble, everyone, but I need a bit of a favor.
Could you remodel my pirate ship to hold an opera stage?
A stage on a ship? Hoo-eee, ma'am! Now that's a humdinger of an idea!
But sure, I'll whip ya up a handy little stage that can be installed on the deck.
＂Little＂ isn't quite what I had in mind. The audience could only be twenty, thirty people at most in that case.
This is the opera, and I want to entertain a whole OCEAN of people!
HmmmMMMM... Yes, I think I see.
So essentially you need a way to fit a stage on your ship that is larger than the vessel itself. Is that accurate?
You picked up on that quick—it seems you ARE as fine an engineer as advertised.
A good thing, too. With you folks on board, my idea may just work!
Hold, lass. Are ye sayin' you've already thought up a way to do this thing?
I have indeed. And the method is...
Gosh, ma'am! That plan's a real head- scratcher. Ya really think it can be done?
Aye, she's a fine plan. If we use the rokkan stonetech engine, that'll keep 'er movin' right trig, so it will.
Which means the rest is all design. Now then, how do we take this novel endeavor and make it reality?
Ooo, but this is exciting. I love nothing better than bending physics to my will!
Aye, and me! We'll see this done, on me honor as a craftswoman!
I'm not much for plans and math and all that, but just tell me what t'build and I'll make sure it's strong as oak.
Leave all your carpentry to me, ma'am!
Well, THIS is filling me with confidence. Go, team! Go forth and make me proud!
Hey, is that my lackeys playing? Seeing how they started, I must admit they're actually sounding pretty good.
Good choice to gather a bunch of folks who love music. They'll make for a splendid orchestra, methinks!
So that's the stage and the music sorted, which means next is...
Hey, Lucretia. How go the lessons?
Well, I suppose the song itself is fine, but there is a slight...issue.
What's that?
I think it might be faster to show you.
Everyone? I'd like you to sing and perform as though you're on stage.
Aye-aye!
G-g-g-give me all y-yer lo-lo-love! ♪
NooOoOOoO, yeeEEr looOoOve bEEee miiIiIIneeeEEeE! ♪
Stop. No. Wait. Don't fight for my love.
Shiver me timbers, this is TERRIBLE.
The first one's stuttering, the second's putting way too much into it, and the third is just reciting things in monotone.
Performance is a difficult thing; you must become someone you're not.
And playing a completely different person in terms of status, upbringing, and the like is exponentially more difficult—especially for a newcomer.
Oh, hell! I didn't even think about how the characters in opera are always nobles and knights and other proper folk!
They might just be too different for a crew of rough-and-tumble pirates.
Yes, I fear that singing an opera will prove quite the challenge for them.
It was hard for me when I played the princess, and I used to BE one!
It's just difficult to play a role you can't find a way to empathize with.
...But I think I know a way around that!
Oh? And what is that?
When I played the princess, it worked because I found aspects of her character that I was able to understand.
Basically, I discovered points where my life overlapped with the role.
Which means we'll just have to perform an opera where the characters AREN'T a bunch of highfalutin' nobility!
There's all kinds of opera out there, and I'm sure we can find one that works if we just look around.
And since no one has more scripts lying around than a professional opera singer, I know just who to call on!
Hello there, Bella. It's been a while. Sorry to barge in like this during practice.
Karina? Oh, but it HAS been a while! Thank you again for your help with that whole ＂phantom thief＂ situation. So then, what brings you here today?
I was wondering if you'd let me sticky- finger some of the scripts for the operas you've performed in.
In particular, I'm looking for ones where the cast isn't all nobles. Farmers, laborers, tavernkeeps... You know. Salt of the earth.
Yes, I've done a few operas in that vein. What has you searching for such a thing, if I might ask?
I'm trying to have my pirate crew put on an opera, and I need to find one that suits their particular...vibe.
Oh my! A pirate opera certainly sounds like a delightful bit of fun!
Wait, really? I figured you'd go off about how it was a terrible idea that will never work in a gazillion years.
Nothing is impossible in this world.
＂No escape?＂ Do you understand to whom you are speaking?
I am the phantom thief, she who makes the impossible possible!
(Am I imagining things here, or is Bella actually pretty similar to Lapis?)
I'm happy to pick out some scripts for you. Just give me a little bit, all right?
...Okay, so she's like Lapis. So what? Focus, Karina! Time to check on the crew!
I know she'll be able to find something that suits my crew perfectly!
All right, you lot! What have you been up to while I...was...out...?
Bweeeeeeeh! Bwah-wah-waaaah!
Gahaaar har har! Yer puttin' me in stitches!
Ugh. You're SUCH a ham.
Welcome back, Cap'n!
And I can't be helpin' it! This sea dog here laughs at all me jokes fit to split!
No need to apologize. I told you all to relax for a bit, and that's clearly what you've been doing.
Aye, we're fresh as a swabbed deck!
Good. Don't want you overdoing it on the practice and singing yourselves hoarse.
...Er, by the way, what's up with him?
Cap'n... Welcome...back... *cough*
What's with your voice?! It's all raspy!
S-sorry, cap'n... I broke your rules and practiced all night... *cough*
I should have seen this coming.
(He's got a lot of pride, that one. Loves nothing better than showing off.)
Well, no use crying about milk spilt overboard, I suppose.
All right, you tars, listen up! I've brought a mountain of scripts back with me, so I want to you read them SILENTLY so you can rest your voices! Got it?!
Aye, Cap'n!
A few days later...
All right, the scripts are all read. Let's get to this, sea dogs!
Aye-aye, Cap'n!
(First, we'll try this screwball comedy.)
(No prideful aristocrats in this one, plus a humorous show would probably go over great with normal folks.)
You cut my lovely hair, but now my bowl cut's square! I'll not pay you a cent, so you can go get bent! ♪
(Yes! It's a perfect casting fit!)
(Plus, he's a funny guy who likes to make people laugh, so he's great for the lead.)
No no, my friend! That will not do! I must have my due for your new 'do! ♪
(Great! She's friendly and charming, so she's great for a role that calls for innocently throwing things off-track.)
You messed up his hair. That isn't fair.  Now he won't look...uh...debonaire. ♪
(Uh oh. He's prideful and wants to be cool, so the idea of being laughed at is making his performance a little wooden.)
All right, I've seen enough! Let's try the next one.
(So in this one, the lead is a bandit.)
There's no chest I can't crack! No loot I can't steal! So stay out of me way, or you'll taste me steel! ♪
(Oh, he's perfect for the role of a clever bandit leader!)
There's no trap that works on me... Now face the wrath of my machete! ♪
(Ha ha! This is a lively role and he's just KILLING it!)
(And for the supporting role...)
My lovely face... Is all style and grace... But look too long and you get the mace! ♪
(Yeaaaah, I think she's a bit too...blunt to play a femme fatale bandit.)
Cut! That's enough! Next one!
...But hard as they tried, they couldn't find a script among the lot that worked for the entire crew.
Yar, sorry, Cap'n. This all be on account of our poor actin' chops, by gar.
Belay that talk, sailor! I'll find something that works—I just need a little more time.
We've got to shore up your foundations, so for now, just work on voice exercises.
...Phew! I know I told them it's fine, but I really am adrift without an oar here.
If worst comes to worst, I suppose one of them may just have to be sort of...bad?
No! What am I thinking?! That will just put the crowd to sleep—or lead to a hail of tomatoes, which I do NOT want to clean.
Plus, the person who ends up in the role that doesn't suit them gets the short end of the plank. I could never do something like that to my sea family!
The sharp-minded, prideful one...
The big ham who doesn't sweat the details...
And the affable, straightforward one...
We've got all sorts, and they're free to act in a way that suits them—THAT'S what this pirate band is all about!
Hell, we've always been a pack of misfits. I wasn't even sure we'd be able to work together at first...
Heh. This takes me back. We've had some pretty crazy adventures over the years...
Hey, wait a minute.
Well, keelhaul me booty... That's IT!
The pirate opera troupe's ship has been remodeled, and the script decided upon. As Karina predicted, practice for their original show has been going smashingly—which means it's time to set sail!
The crew come to call at a lone island in a remote region. When they inform the residents they'll be performing a free opera, word spreads across the island, packing the beach with spectators.
I came here because I heard an opera would be performed, but I don't know how we'll fit everyone onto that ship.
So we might not get to see it?
Whooooa!
What's that?! It made that big noise when it came out of the ship!
It's a stage, dear—and I think they're going to perform on it!
What an amazing setup... Now everyone here has a front-row seat to the show!
Yar, this is going splendidly!
Hold, lass. Are ye sayin' you've already thought up a way to do this thing?
The biggest part of a ship is the hull, so we'll stash the stage in there.
Well, that'd let you fit a stage that's the same size as the ship, all right—but where would your audience folks sit?
Outside! Ports and beaches can hold as many people as we want, so long as we can pull the ship close enough to shore.
Once we're in place, the stage slides out and everyone can enjoy the show!
The flashy mechanism for the stage has got the audience stomping their feet... Talk about two gulls with one cannonball!
Slitherin' eels, they're mighty fired up!
Yaaaar, I be nervous...
Courage, you lily-livered sods! The most important thing for a pirate is courage!
B-but, Cap'n, what happens if I go out there and flub me lines?
It went great in rehearsal, didn't it? So quit worrying!
Have some confidence! You aren't any ordinary pirates anymore, remember?
We're Karina's Pirate Opera Troupe, and we're so amazing that we can even impress a weeping baby!
Cap'n!
Yar, Cap'n Karina be right! That's why she be writin' this opera just for us!
Let's DO this, ye dogs! We'll show them landlubbers what ye get when a pirate sets their mind to somethin'!
Aye-aye!
Looks like you've found your guts at last. Now on with the show!
I am a princess in a cage... It is a fate that makes me rage! ♪
The sky feels so very far away... I wish I could soar up there today... ♪
So beautiful! Yet, so sad... *sniff*
Poor thing, forced into a marriage she didn't want... *sniff*
(Oh, we're drawing 'em in now! You never can go wrong with a classic tragic heroine, am I right?)
(Ah, but, this show doesn't end in tragedy. For you see...)
(...This show is based on MY life!)
But I spit in the eye of destiny... to forge a future made by me! ♪
I'll break my cage! Shatter my bars! And set out tonight for the stars! ♪
What?!
What's gonna happen to the princess?!
Let's watch and see, honey!
(What happens next, they ask? Well, since this is my story, I happen to know...)
Ho lads, look there! A young lady fair! All on her own, she hasn't a prayer! ♪
(Now THAT'S a great performance! 'Course, they're pretty much playing themselves, so I should expect greatness.)
Let's steal her away! Right this very day! We'll hold her for ransom and make her folks pay! ♪
Seize her, ye scurvy dogs!
(Oh, this really takes me back. I remember being taken on board their ship and meeting the original captain...)
Am I on a ship?! Are you pirates true?! Too bad—I'm still not afraid of you! ♪
Aye, pirates we be! Pirates most free! And pirates are always better than ye!
Free! Such a wonderful word! Already I feel my heart stirred! ♪
Please, let me join you!
Whaaat?!
Whaaat?!
Don't make light of us, lass! Don't you dare poke fun! 'Cause pirates are terrors who answer to none! ♪
If courage you want, I have it in spades! I'll trade all I have in life for a blade! Just let me come with you! Let me be free! Let me have a life where I live as ME! ♪
Yar, she's a brave lass and blessed... But can she pass the test?! ♪
We two will stand on the edge of the deck. With sharks below ready to give us heck. If I fall first, then a pirate you be... But if you fall first, that's it for ye! ♪
A challenge most fair! A challenge so true! But know that I'm going to defeat you! ♪
R-really?! Y-yar, ye'll regret this, lassie!
(Who would have thought a pirate wouldn't know how to swim? But he was too full of pride to back down, and in the end, he tumbled into the sea.)
(But that's not part of the show today. It just wouldn't be right tossing him in the water when he can't swim.)
('Bout time for the surrender then, Cap'n. Accordin' to the script.)
Yar...I can't keep this up... Whoa?!
What?!
Oh!
Sweet hardtack! He fell for real!
Yar, we be goin' off-book now! What do we do?!
Don't lose focus! The audience is watching!
Look, it doesn't matter if we're off-book, because this REALLY HAPPENED! Just remember it and run with it!
Yar, I just stood by watching nervously. I didn't have me the courage to leap into the sea with all them sharks.
But Cap'n Karina did!
Then it's decided!
*glub* Yar, I be needin' HAAAALP!
Are you all right?!
Cap'n! Ye saved me!
I'll take that as a yes. Now get your butt back on stage and finish this thing!
We'll go right into the finale!
Aye-aye!
What a relief! The sea dog's okay! I thought he'd meet Davy Jones today! ♪
This lass has beat me. This lass has won. Which means she's captain now, 'cause my time is done! ♪
All hail the new captain! May she bring us all fame! But please, O fair captain... Please tell us your name! ♪
I am Captain Karina! Now weigh anchor! Hoist the main! Mind the jib! The Karina Pirates are setting out!
Huh? There's a ship approaching!
Gahaaar har har! Look there, boys! It be Captain Karina and her crew!
Lady Luck be on our side, ye sods! Time to exact a little payback for what happened to us last time!
Cap'n, look at the flag! It's those dogs we wiped the deck with last time, by gar!
They want revenge NOW?! We're just about to finish the damn show!
Mommy? Are those more pirates?
This show is AMAZING! I can't believe they have a second ship all ready to go!
Um, I'm not sure that's...
Those other pirates are super yell-y... I'm scared! Waaaah!
That's it! I am NOT going to let these soggy sods ruin my opera!
Let's go, boys! Throw that Captain Karina and her crew into the sea!
That's it! I am NOT going to let these soggy sods ruin my opera!
Yar, maybe we need to stop worryin' about the opera, Cap'n?
Those pirates be ready for a scrap, so they be!
Cap'n! They're gonna ram us!
Urgaaah!
How dare ye do what ye did to us! We'll have our revenge!
Ready yerselves for a... Huh? Yar, their ship look passin' strange.
And there be a crowd on the beach. Yar, what're ye sods gawkin' at! This ain't no show!
EEEEK!
You're almost right—this is no ORDINARY show...
This is the OPERA—the greatest of the arts, where we thrill our audience with song AND drama!
We're off-book again, but that's just how these things go. New finale, everyone! It's time for a showdown with this band of ugly mugs!
Ye dirty sea dogs! Ye stain our eyes! But if a fight ye be seekin', we'll gladly oblige! ♪
Yar, why they be singin'...?
SINK HER, YE IDIOTS!
Aye-aye!
You may be a pirate with wiles most sadistic, But if you think you'll defeat me, that's a bit optimistic! ♪
Wooow! She's singing AND fighting!
Thank heavens it's just part of the show!
(Excellent! The audience is calming down. Now to dash these sods on the shoals!)
This is the Karina Pirates' first battle, and I shall mark the day with a victory!
What are ye jabbering on about, Karina?! Do ye seek to play us for fools?!
Oh, not at all. I'm totally serious. Because letting you walk free, would be most deleterious! ♪
Yar, I got no idea what them big words mean, but she be keepin' the opera goin'!
Hold on, Cap'n! Hold on a sec! I be runnin' to your side what to give them dogs heck!
What in the name'a all the hells do they be singin' and fightin' for?!
If ye need brawn, then I be your man! I'll stuff this cur into the garbage can! ♪
Count on me too! Count on me now! If ye need a butt-whuppin', then I'll show ye how! ♪
WHAT THE HELL BE GOIN' ON?!
We're the Karina Pirates! The pirates of fame! And we're gonna make sure you remember our name! ♪
Whoaaaargh!
Yar, he be fallin' into the deep!
Ye fool! Don't ye see?! Now you're open to me! ♪
Uwaaargh!
D-dammit! We'll be back!
Ye may have beaten us today, but there always be tomorrow!
We're not afraid! We've courage to spare! And if you want a fight, we'll always be there! ♪
The pirate lady is soooo cool!
That was such fun!
And so moving!
Gar, listen to that applause... The cap'n did it, so she did!
They're not clapping for me, you daft dogs...
It's for all of us.
Yar, they be complimentin' me? I can't be believin' it... *sniff*
*sniff* N-now I be moved, by gar!
You played your parts well, everyone. Time to line up and bow to the crowd.
AYE-AYE, CAP'N KARINA!
To the actors, the orchestra, and the crew, thank you for all of your hard work.
Now...let's get this cast party GOING!
Gahar har har! What a day!
Me blood ran cold when ye tumbled into the briney blue, so it did!
And me timbers shivered when those other pirates dogs appeared!
Yes, but that made for the perfect finale. Lucky thing, that.
In fact, I think we're going to have a big fight at the end of EVERY performance!
And hey, that's how it went down back in the day too. You fell into the water and everyone found out you can't swim.
Then you attacked me when I saved you. I get you were embarrassed and all, but you still ended up losing to me.
Yar, no need to open old wounds...
GAHAR HAR HAR HAR!
All right, we'll table that for now. Still, changing the script a tad bit with every performance sounds like great fun!
After all, this is an opera that's free and unbound by anything at all!
It should be fun not only for the audience, but also for the performers!
All right, sea dogs! When the sun rises, we're setting off for the next island!
Aye-aye, Cap'n!
The next morning, Karina and her crew set sail into the great, wide sea.
Yar, that be a fine tailwind... Hoist the sail, lads! We're off!
We're Karina's Pirate Opera Troupe! We steal boredom and deliver freedom, and no one ever stands in our way!
